intro: Serapias olbia, commonly known as the Balkan sandwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Rockcress (Capparaceae) and is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, linear leaves. The plant produces yellow-orange flowers with five petals, typically blooming from May to July. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Serapias olbia is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it adapts to harsh environmental conditions.
